moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 c5 3. d5 b5 4. cxb5 a6 5: This move is just as good as 5. bxa6.  Psychologically, I always found it difficult to be on the black side of this.
moves.6... d6 7. Nf3: This will transpose to the same line as e4.
moves.7... Nbd7 8. Rb1: e4 and Qc2 were also playable here.
moves.8... Bb7: Computer analysis prefered g6 on the last couple of moves.
moves.9. e4 g6 10. Bc4: Slightly better than Be2 or Bf4 as white prepares for a possible e5.
moves.10... Bg7 11. O-O a5: Castling would have been slightly better.
moves.12. b3: Qe2, Qc2, Bd2 and Re1 were also good.
moves.12... Ba6: Black ignores castling, but it is not going to hurt him yet.
moves.13. Na4: There are a lot of other good moves here like Bb2, Qc2, Qe2, and Nd2.  White has a slight edge.
moves.15. bxc4 Qc7 16. Nc3 O-O 17. Nb5: White has a strong advantage with a lot of choices here.  Re1 is just as good.
moves.17... Qc8: It would be easier to defend e5 with Qb8, although Black has to then be aware of any potential attack on the file.
moves.18. Qe2: White actually lost here by overstepping the time control.  What follows is computer analysis on how the game could have continued.
